name: Angel Hair Pasta with Garlic Shrimp and Broccoli
author: Robbie Rice
summary: This makes the best cream sauce I've ever had. It's a quick meal that is a sure way to impress company without the hassle.
ingredients: ½ (16 ounce) package frozen broccoli florets, thawed
1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
5 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat
Stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes
Slowly stir in milk and cream; simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened
Mix in pesto, parsley, 3 cloves minced garlic, Parmesan cheese, 1 teaspoon salt, white pepper, Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce
Reduce heat to low and allow to simmer
Meanwhile, place broccoli in a steamer over 1 inch of boiling water, and cover
Cook until tender but still firm, about 2 to 6 minutes
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet
Saute shrimp, remaining 3 cloves minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon salt for 5 minutes, or until shrimp are pink
In a large bowl, toss pasta, shrimp and broccoli; pour sauce over and serve
